Description: Ostracon, large section (two fragments joined) of the body of a pale-red pottery bowl with circular foot, flaring base, straight sides and everted ledge-rim, the fabric is pink in section, the body is covered with a red-brown slip and the rim is painted black, the exterior is elaborated with one line of incised Coptic text.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell & J. Faiers
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394137) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394137)
